JLJ4569038 Portrait en pied de Charles Maurice de Talleyrand Perigord, Prince de Benevent (1754-1838) Painting by Francois Gerard (1770-1837). 1808. Dim. 0, 32 x 0, 22 m. Versailles, Chateau Museum by Gerard, Francois Pascal Simon, Baron (1770-1837); Musee et Domaine National de Versailles et de Trianon, Versailles, France; (add.info.: Portrait en pied de Charles Maurice de Talleyrand Perigord, Prince de Benevent (1754-1838) Painting by Francois Gerard (1770-1837). 1808. EDITORS COMMENTS

This print showcases a remarkable portrait of Charles Maurice de Talleyrand Perigord, Prince de Benevent, painted by Francois Gerard in 1808. The painting measures 0.32 x 0.22 meters and is housed in the prestigious Versailles Chateau Museum. Charles Maurice de Talleyrand Perigord (1754-1838) was a prominent figure in French history, known for his diplomatic skills and political influence during the tumultuous times of the French Revolution and Napoleonic era. This full-length portrait captures his commanding presence and dignified demeanor. Painted with great attention to detail, Gerard's masterful brushwork brings out every nuance of Talleyrand's features, from his piercing gaze to the subtle lines etched on his face that speak volumes about his experiences. The artist skillfully portrays him wearing formal attire befitting his status as a prince. Displayed against an elegant backdrop, this painting not only serves as a visual representation of one man but also symbolizes an entire era marked by political upheaval and military prowess. It offers viewers a glimpse into the world of power dynamics and diplomacy that shaped France during the early 19th century. With its historical significance and artistic excellence, this print is a testament to both Talleyrand's enduring legacy and Gerard's talent as a painter. It stands as an exquisite piece within the collection at Versailles Chateau Museum, inviting admiration from art enthusiasts worldwide.
